body: the old men burnish stories of Yaz and the BabeSwaying in unison beneath the snow,End of the comedy.Alberti, Brunelleschi, Sangallo,To have been claimed by what we see of whatAway, my songs, must we goOnly a whiter absence to my mind,The pain of being born into matter.Introduction by Vilhjalmur StefanssonIn stone waves and rock waters, far from day,Across the heavens' gray.Calling me to you with wild gesturingsA frame of glided twilight—ISculpting each tree to fit your ghostly form.snoozing. A schoolgirl on vacation gapes,When Arctic winds crack down from CanadaThat patch of white at the very end of the roadStars, the last day, endless and centerless,with visors. Their brave recreational vehicles
